intro: Gladiolus segetum proles bornetii, commonly known as the Bornetii gladiolus, is a rare and ornamental plant native to specific regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sturdy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. Due to its limited distribution and conservation status, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
